feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Workstations
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Workstations

entry.content:
You can provide custom metadata for a workstation's host VM.

Use the --instance-metadata flag with the gcloud workstations configs create and gcloud workstations configs update commands. Format the metadata as a comma-separated list of key-value pairsâ€”for example, --instance-metadata=key1=value1,key2=value2.

Note that updating metadata replaces all existing custom metadata for the workstation instance.
entry.summary: You can now provide custom metadata for your workstation's host VMs. Use the --instance-metadata flag with the gcloud workstations configs create and update commands to set key-value pairs. Note that updating metadata will replace all existing custom metadata.
entry.title: Feature: Add custom metadata to workstation VMs

entry.content:
Cloud Workstations supports specifying a custom startup script to be executed on the workstation's host VM during boot.

Provide the custom startup script as a Google Cloud Storage URL, such as gs://BUCKET/FILE, using the --startup-script-uri flag with the gcloud workstations configs create and gcloud workstations configs update commands.
entry.summary: You can now specify a custom startup script to run when your Cloud Workstation's host VM boots. Provide the script as a Google Cloud Storage URL using the --startup-script-uri flag with gcloud workstations configs create and update commands.
entry.title: Feature: Custom startup scripts for Cloud Workstations

entry.content:
Cloud Workstations supports Hyperdisk Balanced High Availability (hyperdisk-balanced-ha) for persistent directories on configurations using A3, C3, C4, G4, M3, N4, N4D, and Z3 machine series. You can specify the disk type using the --disk-type flag with the gcloud workstations configs create and gcloud workstations configs update commands.

Cloud Workstations supports A3 machine types with Hyperdisk only. For more details, see Available machine types and Available GPUs.
entry.summary: Cloud Workstations now supports Hyperdisk Balanced High Availability for persistent directories on select machine types, including A3, C3, C4, G4, M3, N4, N4D, and Z3. This enhancement improves data durability and availability for your development environments. You can configure this new disk type using the `--disk-type` flag in gcloud commands.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Workstations adds Hyperdisk Balanced HA support

entry.content: Cloud Workstations predefined images include Node.js 24 (LTS). The previous version, 20.19.6, is no longer pre-installed. To continue using a previous version, you can customize your container images to include it or add a version manager like NVM.
entry.summary: Cloud Workstations now includes Node.js 24 (LTS) as a predefined image, replacing version 20.19.6. If you need to use a previous version, you can customize your container images or use a version manager like NVM.
entry.title: Change: Node.js 24 now available in Cloud Workstations

entry.content: Cloud Workstations predefined images include Eclipse Temurin JDK 21 and 25. JDK 11 is no longer pre-installed. To continue using JDK 11, customize your container images.
entry.summary: Cloud Workstations now includes Temurin JDK 21 and 25. JDK 11 is no longer pre-installed. To keep using JDK 11, customize your container images.
entry.title: Change: Cloud Workstations Image Update

entry.content: Cloud Workstations is available in the europe-central2 region (Warsaw). For more information, see Locations.
entry.summary: Cloud Workstations is now accessible in the `europe-central2` region, located in Warsaw. For a comprehensive list of available regions, please refer to the documentation.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Workstations now in Warsaw

entry.content: The JetBrains readiness server lets you configure the port it listens on and the timeout when you specify the JETBRAINS_READY_SERVER_PORT and JETBRAINS_READY_SERVER_TIMEOUT environment variables in your workstation environment. For more information about setting environment variables, see Customizing your environment.
entry.summary: You can now configure the JetBrains readiness server port and timeout using environment variables. This allows for greater flexibility in customizing your development environment.
entry.title: Feature: JetBrains Readiness Server Configuration

entry.summary: The JetBrains CLion preconfigured base image has been updated to use CLion 2025.1.1.
entry.title: Changed: CLion Updated to Version 2025.1.1

entry.summary: The JetBrains GoLand preconfigured base image has been updated to use GoLand 2025.1.1. This update includes the latest features and improvements from JetBrains for Go development.
entry.title: Changed: GoLand Updated to 2025.1.1

entry.content: The JetBrains IntelliJ Ultimate preconfigured base image uses IntelliJ-IDEA 2025.1.1
entry.summary: The IntelliJ IDEA 2025.1.1 preconfigured base image for Cloud Workstations has been updated to the latest version.
entry.title: Changed: IntelliJ IDEA base image updated

entry.summary: The JetBrains PhpStorm preconfigured base image has been updated to PhpStorm 2025.1.1.
entry.title: Changed: PhpStorm base image updated

entry.summary: The JetBrains WebStorm preconfigured base image has been updated to use WebStorm version 2025.1.1.
entry.title: Changed: WebStorm base image updated

entry.summary: The JetBrains RubyMine preconfigured base image has been updated to use RubyMine 2025.1.1.
entry.title: Changed: RubyMine Updated

entry.summary: The JetBrains PyCharm preconfigured base image has been updated to use PyCharm version 2025.1.1.1.
entry.title: Changed: PyCharm base image updated

entry.summary: The JetBrains Rider preconfigured base image has been updated to version 2025.1.2.
entry.title: Changed: Rider base image updated
